name: ./cornell
tagline: Bringing Big Red App back to the 80s
body:
_So it's like Cornell info on your Terminal._

### Install

If you have node.js: 

    npm install -g cornell

If you dont have node.js:

    curl https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mrkev/cornell/master/lib/install.sh | bash

### Usage 
 - `cornell --help` - Always a good idea 
 - `cornell eat` - Let's you pick a hall, view the menu.
 - `cornell eat okies` - Okenshields' menu.
 - `cornell class mexico` - Search roster for classes containing "mexico".
 - `cornell class -s CS compilers` - Search CS classes containing compilers.

### Wait but why.
1. Cause it's uber cool. Back in the 80s life was good; UIs didn't suck, the grass was green, and kids weren't whining about their scrolling animations or their OTA software updates. Back then you could `grep` and `cron` and `tmux` and that was all you needed.

2. To up your vintage game, bruh.

### And how?
[nodejs](https://nodejs.org)

## Any more questions?

[Ask me stuff](http://thatkevin.tk/ask)
